question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I had the opportunity to engage with computational methods and practices such as procedural 3D modeling, photogrammetry, 3D printing, projection mapping, and physical computing that can enhance my research. Additionally, I had the opportunity to enhance my creative and practical learning skills through the projects we were required to develop in a short timeframe.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I developed discipline more than anything. Every concept in this class was very difficult to me and I really struggled to adapt to the language of the course. Each assignment required lots of time and attention and frustration. I learned to adjust my work and ideas to the provided tools/software, as well as troubleshooting skills.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: various digital media art skills for visualizing ideas

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about different types of programs and technology like SketchUp, Houdini, and Touch Designer. It was really interesting to explore the making process with the different modules,

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I believe the methodology of doing the projects in modules, in which you work on it through 3-4 weeks, is great; it allows us to have time to be more familiar and comfortable with new software/digital tools and to improve the ideas over time. This method was certainly efficient for me, and although the course was fast-paced, I could keep up with the assignments throughout the weeks.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The course's modular structure and lighter submissions, instead of a final project, were effective in terms of quickly engaging with various methodologies and software tools. It was sometimes challenging, especially when I wanted to develop more complex ideas. However, the scope of the submissions was clear and manageable, which kept projects from becoming overly time-consuming or needing finalization. I also appreciated Professor Olson's efforts, such as the detailed and clear written and video instructions he sent every week, which made the assignments and learning process much easier.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the creative aspects of the projects and using these computational capacities to engage with more theoretical/humanities-based ideas.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course introduced students to a wide range of methods and tools in digital humanities. I found this especially useful, as I had previously been interested in the field but never had the proper training. I enjoyed learning about the four affordances, the idea of digital reconnaissance, and mixed reality vs augmented reality.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We delved into theory of digital humanities from multiple aspects, such as distant reading, visualization, and GIS. Also, we were introduced to the tools that are used in these fields, such as CHGIS, Omeka.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about various forms of bias in data and Digital Humanities projects more broadly. I also got an overview of some of the current and relevant literature in the field.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The course was structured in a way that had students present on the readings each week. This allowed students to gain experience synthesizing information and presenting it to a big group, but there were also some readings or concepts that I feel should have been introduced by the professor, instead (i.e. the major topics or themes that would underscore the entire semester). Class discussions were always engaging and the professor would always jump in if there was something that she needed to say, correct, or introduce, but overall the structure relied a lot on trusting other students to understand the material and relay it to each other.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
